item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S7604-7605; text as passed Senate: CR S7604; text of measure as introduced: CR S7617-7618)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S7604-7605; text as passed Senate: CR S7604; text of measure as introduced: CR S7617-7618)

summary.text:
Celebrates the 60th anniversary of the U.S.-Australia alliance that anchors peace and prosperity in the Asia-Pacific region and in the world.

Supports U.S. efforts to strengthen military, diplomatic, trade, economic, and people-to-people cooperation with Australia.

Urges close consultation between the governments of the United States and Australia in preparation for the East Asia Summit.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary has been expanded because action occurred on the measure.)

Celebrates the 60th anniversary of the U.S.-Australia alliance that anchors peace and prosperity in the Asia-Pacific region and in the world.

Supports U.S. efforts to strengthen military, diplomatic, trade, economic, and people-to-people cooperation with Australia.

Urges close consultation between the governments of the United States and Australia in preparation for the East Asia Summit, and encourages new forms of cooperation with the government and people of Australia.

bill.title: A resolution commemorating the 60th Anniversary of the United States-Australia alliance.

item.title: A resolution commemorating the 60th Anniversary of the United States-Australia alliance.
A resolution commemorating the 60th Anniversary of the United States-Australia alliance.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
